intro: Beilschmiedia zeylanica, commonly known as the Ceylon beilschmiedia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers followed by dark blue, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a significant species in its native habitat.
